sub_title: AI Research Engineer at Helsing | Artificial Intelligence To Serve Our Democracies
summary:
Helsing is a new type of security and artificial intelligence company.

Our purpose is to attain technology leadership so that democratic societies are free to make sovereign decisions and control their ethical standards.

We’re building a real-time platform for information processing in the defence, intelligence and security domains, to aid sense making for faster and more reliable decisions.

We’re looking for people with their heart in the right place, who share our conviction that liberal democratic values are worth protecting, for ourselves and for future generations.

treasury_media.title: Java 9: Jigsaw Project
treasury_media.description:
This presentation, inspired by the Lord of the Rings trilogy, depicts one of the most anticipated features of the JDK 9: Project Jigsaw. 
It covers the following topics: Architecture; Accessibility; Modularisation; Implied Readability; Restricted Readability; Fat JARs; and Java Images.

Al the source code, inclusive a extensive documentation, can be found here: https://github.com/ekholabs/postcode-modules

treasury_media.title: Microservices with Spring Cloud
treasury_media.description: That presentation covers some aspects of Spring Cloud and Netflix OSS projects, with a working demo using Java 8 and the the goodies that Spring offers. The source code of the demo can be found here -> https://github.com/ekholabs/bookstore-microservices

treasury_media.title: Embracing Reactive Streams with Java 9 and Spring 5
treasury_media.description: This talk is about going back to the basics, when Reactive Programming was not a buzz and not used in the Enterprise Arena. There will be moments when you will regret being here, but then we will present you with the Beauty of the Seventies. This talk intends to make you travel through time, experiencing how things were done back then. From the Beauty of the Seventies we will move straight to the GoF Observer pattern, which has been implemented over and over again with Publish / Subscriber mechanisms. That will depict the foundations of what we have seen with Functional Programming, Reactive Programming, FRP and Reactive Streams. Although all that sounds interesting, it’s not our last stop. We still have to go over Java 9 and Spring Web Reactive Framework. It embraces Reactive Streams and Reactor, by defying the challenge of switching from imperative-style to non-blocking logic. It might be seem by some as shiny and new, but it’s based on a well established idea that has been helping us for more than 40 years.

treasury_media.title: Machine intelligence
treasury_media.description: This talk is divided in 3 parts: inspiration to study; the business aspects of Artificial Intelligence; and its technical aspects, with a practical demo and technical explanations about Overfitting, NN, CNN, PCA and feature extraction. The code used during the demo will soon be on Github.

projects.title: Irdeto Middleware
projects.description:
Research & Development – Digital TV

PushVOD 2.1

Development of new calls for the RESTful API of Irdeto's Data Signalling System, and the multi-catalog/profile feature of Irdeto's PushVOD 2.1 system

Irdeto Middleware 2.1

Dynamic Data Processor
The DDP module retrieves information from the DST (i.e. Data Stream Table) existing in the transport streams and notifies resident applications/xlets, responsible by handling the data.

Search for Recommendations
Extension of the existing search engine embedded in the Middleware. The extended search mechanism retrieves information from the EIT (i.e. Event Information Table) existing in the transport stream and parses its content in order to verify whether events are recommended or not.

PushVOD / EPGBuilder: In the first 2 months at Irdeto Wilder worked, and learned, Python programming language in order to implement an API to be able to expose RESTful services from the Data Signalling System to both Irdeto’s PushVOD and EPGBuilder. The API was fully unit tested, achieving 93% of coverage.

profile_positions.description:
In a normal day, a lot of this will happen:

* Data acquisition (in the field) and processing
* Model development, maintenance and deployment
* TensorRT Engine builder for quantising DL models
* Massive contributions throughout several repositories

profile_positions.title: AI Research Engineer
Member of the Industry Advisory Board

profile_positions.description:
With quarterly gatherings for Applied Artificial Intelligence, we are aiming to bring together startups, corporates, academics & government active in the AI sphere in the region of Amsterdam to understand the current state of these technologies, their value added for businesses, and what is in store for the near future.

We are a global network of 40+ cities that work together to DISCOVER the field of Applied AI technologies, CONNECT to the top peers in this field on a global level and SHARE local knowledge and talent from their city. 

https://amsterdam.city.ai/
profile_positions.title: Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
* Tutoring and leading a group of 6 students from the Hogeschool Utrecht on the development of an End-to-End system for semantic segmentation of socket plates.

* Organising sharing sessions and technical presentations with the team to help spread knowledge about Computer Vision and the latest techniques in the industry and academia.

* Collaborated with the Hogeschool van Amsterdam on improving the Frustratingly Simple Few-Shot Object Detection paper, making possible to use it on custom datasets. The original paper was published by Wang et al at the ICML 2020. We are currently busy writing our results and a framework.

* Contributed to the development of a Text Classifier using the HuggingFaces Transformers package aiming to understand customers churn reasons.

* Contributed to the development of an End-to-End Object Detection system, based on the YOLOv3 architecture, used to help customers detect their in-home appliances when following the self-installation steps.

* Set-up and contributed to the development of the data collection strategy for the Object Detection project using CVAT, MS VoTT, OpenCV and AWS, with a mobile app developed for the technicians to make pictures.

* Lead a group of 5 students from the Hogeschool Utrecht during a 20 weeks project on the development of a data collection tool to improve our images catalog.

* Developed a proof of concept for the VodafoneZiggo TEC Campus model smart-house to demonstrate face detection and identification using the front-door camera.

Technology stack:

* TensorFlow 2
* TensorFlow Datasets
* PyTorch
* Huggingface Transformers 
* Pandas & PySpark
* Python 3
* OpenCV
* YOLOv3
* MLflow
* Docker
* AWS
* NVIDIA GPUs
* Git

profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Advisory and support to two Chinese students finishing their graduation at the EFREI group, in France.

The students, Tianhong Yu and Xiao Wang, worked on the ES-Code, an idea I had and developed in 2012/13, for a period of 3 months
The ES-Code is the result of an algorithm that translates ASCII and binary date into a 2D image. The project was split in 12 sprints, with a bi-weekly cycle. In the first 6 sprints, we created a web application, which could be used to encode and decode ASCII and binary using the ES-Code algorithms1. The second half of the project was dedicated to the correction of some issues in the algorithms when handling binary data.

1: the ES-Code algorithm is currently closed-source. It is registered at the Benelux Office for Intellectual Property under the number ED041560.

Being a PMC member entails responsibility for the proper management and oversight of the project, including complying with legal guidelines, electing new committers and PMC members, and providing guidance for the project as a whole.

Being an Apache Software Foundation committer, I have been involved in the development of the following features of the Apache CloudStack:

* Redundant Virtual Private Clouds (a.k.a. VPC) implementation
* Refactor of the XenServer hypervisor plugin
* Refactor of the Libvirt (KVM) hypervisor plugin
* Refactor of the NiciraNVP network plugin
* REST API call to update Cluster/Hosts passwords

Technologes involved:

* Java 7/8
* Python 2.7
* KeepaliveD + VRRP
* XenServer and KVM hypervisors
* Debian and CentOS
